data.title: Department of Chemical Engineering
data.text:
ChE Awards

Student Awards

Faculty and Staff Awards

Student Awards

Calvin S. Cronan Award

The Award recognizes excellence in both written and verbal communication.

Nabil Morris Award

This award is given out to a junior chemical engineering student who exhibits high moral character and has demonstrated outstanding academic achievement. This award is decided on by the chemical engineering faculty.

Omega Chi Epsilon Award

This Award is an honor bestowed by the Northeastern chapter of Omega Chi Epsilon, the Honor Society for Chemical Engineering on those members of the student body and the Faculty who have demonstrated exceptional achievement in Chemical Engineering.

Kovell Engineering Scholarship

The Kovell Engineering Scholarship is granted for endeavors in Chemical Engineering, to students who demonstrate initiative, self-help, and helpfulness to others.

Professor Bernard Goodwin Scholarship

This award is established to confer honor upon students who have demonstrated hard work and passion for Chemical Engineering. In 2015, Georges Melhem endowed a scholarship in Professor Goodwin’s honor to support undergraduates who decide to major in chemical engineering.

Ron Willey Process Safety Award

The Award recognizes Chemical Engineering undergraduate senior(s) for excellence in process safety.

Behrooz Satvat Award for Undergraduate Teaching

The Award recognizes contributions and accomplishments by undergraduate students in teaching Chemical Engineering.

Undergraduate Research Awards

The Award recognizes chemical engineering students for outstanding contributions to science and engineering research.

Ralph A. Buonopane Award

The Ralph Buonopane Award is granted to students for exemplifying the integration of practical and classroom training in Chemical Engineering and showing outstanding professional promise.

Don Wood Industrial Advisory Board Service Award

The Award recognizes outstanding and prolonged service to the Chemical Engineering Department’s undergraduate organizations and activities.

American Institute of Chemists Award

The American Institute of Chemists Student Award Program honors outstanding seniors, post-baccalaureate, and post-doctoral students majoring in chemistry, chemical engineering or biochemistry. The awards are given in recognition of a demonstrated ability, leadership, and professional promise. Candidates are chosen and nominated by their faculty members.

Best Chemical Engineering Teaching Assistant Award

The Award recognizes the contributions of their teaching assistants to their learning.

Best Master’s GPA Award

The Award recognizes outstanding and prolonged service to the Chemical Engineering Department’s undergraduate organizations and activities.

PhD Research Award

The Award recognizes outstanding research conducted by a PhD student in Chemical Engineering.

PhD Teaching Award

The Award recognizes contributions and accomplishments by PhD students in teaching Chemical Engineering.

PhD Leadership & Service Award

The Award recognizes outstanding leadership and service to the Chemical Engineering Department.

MS Teaching, Service, and Leadership Award

The Award recognizes contributions and accomplishments by master’s students in teaching Chemical Engineering.

Outstanding Service Award

The Award recognizes service and leadership to the graduate student community and department at large.

Graduate Student Travel Award

The Award is given to increase diversity in conference participation, to provide members of the department with essential professional development and networking opportunities, and to advance our department’s goals.

Distinguished Alumni Award

The Award recognizes our alumni who have made remarkable contributions over the course of their career in service of society and science.

Alumni Service Award

The Award recognizes our alumni who, through service within and to the Department, have contributed to Chemical Engineering’s success at all levels, from students to programs.

Young Alumni Award

The Award recognizes outstanding service to the Department of Chemical Engineering within 15 years of graduation.

Capstone Mentor Recognition

The Award recognizes mentors who volunteered their time and expertise to our capstone students and their projects.

Jeffrey R. Pierce Award

For selfless devotion to enhance our department’s learning community and ensure opportunities for personal growth beyond the classroom and co-op experiences, and for outstanding service to the Department of Chemical Engineering and the American Institute of Chemical Engineers (AIChE).

AIChE Academic Excellence Award

The Award recognizes students who attain the highest scholastic grade-point average during their freshman and sophomore years.

AIChE Outstanding Newcomer Awards

The Award is given for outstanding service and leadership potential to the AIChE student chapter.

AIChE Senior Recognition

The Award recognizes active AIChE graduating seniors.

AIChE Outstanding Leadership Award

The Award recognizes and rewards outstanding contributions to the AIChE Student Chapter in executive roles: President and Vice President.

ChemE Car Outstanding Member Awards

The Award recognizes and rewards outstanding leadership and contributions to ChemE Car.

Outstanding Contributions to ChemE Car Team as Captains

The Award recognizes and rewards outstanding contributions to the ChemE Car Team as captains.

ChemE Sports Most Valuable Player (MVP)

The Award recognizes and rewards outstanding contributions to the ChemE Sports team.

ChemE Sports Outstanding Mentoring by an Alum

The Award recognizes outstanding mentoring from an alumni to the ChemE Sports team.

Outstanding Contributions to ChemE Sports Team as Captains

The Award recognizes outstanding contributions to the ChemE Sports team as captains.

Faculty and Staff Awards

Dr. Richard H. Sioui Excellence in Mentoring Award

Richard H. Sioui was an alumnus of Northeastern University’s Chemical Engineering program from 1959-1964 who established an award to celebrate professors for going beyond the normal expectations of an instructor to make a positive impact on students’ education and careers.

Gilda Barabino Excellence in Mentoring Award

Gilda Barabino has been a member of the Northeastern University’s Chemical Engineering Department since 1989 and attained the title of associate professor in 1995. She was the Vice Provost for Undergraduate Education at Northeastern from 2000 to 2002 and was a professor from 2005 to 2007. An award was established in her name to honor faculty members who are research-active and who promote the successful research careers of chemical engineering undergraduate students, graduate students, postdoctoral fellows and alumni at Northeastern University.
